title: Item set file sizes?
body:
At the moment, mah pc is out of commission hence why I can't find and see for myself.

Fearing the impending abolishment of making/tinkering items sets, I asked around and have been lead to believe that, if I were to create a final wave of item sets (I plan to do this case on my friends pc), locate the files, copy em and store them for when my pc is back up and running.

That I could then transfer them over to mah pc and use them, thus eliminating the problem of not having a pc when item sets are locked down.

One problem, I need to know how big a general item set for a champ would be (let's assume, 4 bars of items with 7 items in each of them) so I can prepare a dedicated device accordingly (only thing I have is occupied as my pc back up).

Any insight would be awesome.

replies.body:
There is no file size, since item sets are now saved server-side and not locally on your PC.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

I see.
I assume that means that I won't be able to find the files to back them up?
Correct, but they're already backed up for you on the server! ^.^

My ItemSets.json that existed previously was 6.32 KB for 6 different item sets (still exists in my LoL folder).

It would make a lot of sense if we went back to having them stored client-side. It's better than not at all, and the game client's code exists to draw from that file in old builds.
Lets players still customize them, without Riot having to actually make an editor for new client untill they get other priorities taken care of.
